org.apache.juneau.http

Class ReaderResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.http.ReaderResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ResolvingReaderResource

    @Response
public class ReaderResource
extends Object
implements Writable
    Represents the contents of a text file with convenience methods for resolving SVL variables and adding HTTP response headers.


    These objects can be returned as responses by REST methods.

    ReaderResources are meant to be thread-safe and reusable objects.
    The contents of the request passed into the constructor are immediately converted to read-only strings.

    Instances of this class can be built using ReaderResource.Builder.

    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > ReaderResource

      • ReaderResource

        public ReaderResource(MediaType mediaType,
                      Map<String,Object> headers,
                      boolean cached,
                      Object... contents)
               throws IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - The resource media type.
        headers - The HTTP response headers for this streamed resource.
        cached - Identifies if this resource is cached in memory.
        If true, the contents will be loaded into a String for fast retrieval.
        contents - The resource contents.
        If multiple contents are specified, the results will be concatenated.
        Contents can be any of the following:
        • InputStream
        • Reader - Converted to UTF-8 bytes.
        • File
        • CharSequence - Converted to UTF-8 bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • toCommentStrippedString

        public String toCommentStrippedString()
        Same as toString() but strips comments from the text before returning it.

        Supports stripping comments from the following media types: HTML, XHTML, XML, JSON, Javascript, CSS.

        Returns:
        The resource contents stripped of any comments.
